message:
Welcome to my shop!

Please browse my selection of fine wares.

replies.text: Please show me your wares.

message:
Oh my, will I ever get any sleep with those drunkards singing like that?

Someone should do something about them.

replies.text: Can I rest here?
Do you have anything to trade?

message:
Sure kid, you may rest here.

Pick any bed you want.

replies.text: Thanks, bye

message:
Drink drink drink, drink some more.
Drink drink drink 'til you're on the floor.

Hey kid, wanna join us in our drinking game?

replies.text: No thanks.
Maybe some other time.

message:
Never mind those drunken fellas, they're always causing trouble.

Want something to eat?

replies.text: Do you have anything to trade?
Have you got some task or mission for me?
I have brought the bread to Edwin.

message: I heard you helped Odair clean out that old supply cave. Thanks a lot, we'll start using it soon.

replies.text: It was my pleasure.

message: Please do not disturb me, I have work to do.

replies.text: Have you seen my brother Andor?

message: What?! Can't you see I'm busy? Go bother someone else.

replies.text: Have you seen my brother Andor?

message: Andor? No, I haven't seen him around lately.

Well well, what have we here? A visitor, how nice. I'm impressed you got this far through all my minions.

Now prepare to die, puny creature.

replies.text: Great, I have been waiting for a fight!
Let's see who dies here.
Please don't hurt me!

message: Oh mortal, free me from this cursed world!

replies.text: Oh, I'll free you from it alright.
You mean, by killing you?

message: Yes I do have a task for you. A hermit moved in the house south of our village. He pays me to bring him some bread every two days but I can't go this time as I have to watch over those drunkards. Could you do it for me?

replies.text: Okay, I'm going to bring him his bread.
Will I be paid?
I'm on a hurry right now, I'll come back later.

message: I'll pay you five gold pieces for the run when you come back.

replies.text: Sounds honest.
Five gold is not enough. Maybe another day.

message: Thank you, come back when you brought him the bread. I'll pay you five gold pieces for the run.

Oh great! Thanks for doing this!
Here's your gold!

Yes I do have a task for you. A hermit moved in the house south of our village. He pays me to bring him some bread every two days but I can't go this time as I have to watch over those drunkards. Could you do it for me?

replies.text: Okay, I'm going to bring him his bread.
Will I be paid?
I'm on a hurry right now, I'll come back later.

message: I'm sorry but I've already given you the bread. Have you lost it?
No, I don't have anything to do for you at the moment. Maybe later...
